translation.en: [host 1 in Korean] Today is the debut of YG's newest girl group in seven years.
translation.zh:
‎时隔七年
‎YG娱乐今天推出最新女团

translation.en: Introducing BLACKPINK!
♪ BLACKPINK… ♪
[host 2 in Korean] Please give it up for BLACKPINK!
[all together] Hello, we're BLACKPINK!
[Michael Strahan in English] Our next guests are the best-charting female Korean group of all time.
translation.zh: ‎下面的嘉宾是史上最卖座的韩国女团

translation.en: …wildly popular K-pop group…
translation.zh: ‎超级受欢迎的韩国流行乐团体

translation.en: K-pop sensations, BLACKPINK!
[reporter 1] BLACKPINK has become the highest charting K-pop girl group ever.
translation.zh:
‎BLACKPINK已成为
‎史上最卖座的韩国流行音乐女团

translation.en: [reporter 2] They also made history as they became
the first K-pop girl group to perform at Coachella.
translation.zh:
‎成为第一个在科切拉音乐节
‎演出的韩国流行音乐女团

translation.en: [host 3] Performing it live for the first time ever on US television,
here is BLACKPINK!
-[host 4] BLACKPINK! -BLACKPINK!
[in Korean] Congratulations, BLACKPINK.
[host 5] BLACKPINK!
-[Lisa] I'm so hungry. -[Jennie] Are you?
-Did I eat something today? -[Lisa] No.
There's a dessert. It's like a croissant with injeolmi.
translation.zh: ‎有甜点 像是羊角面包加麻薯

translation.en: You guys don't like injeolmi?
It tastes really good. [giggles]
[Jennie] Every time a new album comes, we're just excited. We're like,
translation.zh: ‎每次有新专辑 我们就很兴奋

translation.en: "Ah, yay. Finally, one more," you know?
translation.zh: ‎“哇 终于来了 又是一张”

translation.en: I think we're halfway there, maybe?
We're always halfway there. We're like, "We have the songs…
translation.zh: ‎我们一向是已经完成了一半 ‎我们的歌已经有了 只要录一下就行

translation.en: there. We just need to record them."
translation.zh: ‎我们的歌已经有了 只要录一下就行

translation.en: [Jisoo in Korean] Seeing so many people love our music
translation.zh: ‎看到有这么多人爱我们的音乐

translation.en: motivates us to try something new and different.
translation.zh: ‎促使我们想要尝试新的不一样的东西

translation.en: [in English] It's time for us to do some music. Yeah.
[Jennie] We just have so much to show people.
I don't think we've done something really girly yet.
translation.zh:
‎我觉得我们没有做过
‎很有女孩样的东西

translation.en: We've practiced and explored so many different things, um, during our trainee days,
translation.zh:
‎我们做练习生的时候
‎练习并探索了很多不同的东西

translation.en: and so it's just a matter of how much of that we could end up showing as BLACKPINK.
translation.zh:
‎所以问题只是我们作为BLACKPINK
‎能够展示出多少

translation.en: I think, for me, when I say girly, I want to do more like…
translation.zh: ‎我觉得 我说女孩样的东西 就是指…

translation.en: like… [softly] "Hello…"
-[all giggle] -[Rosé] Like what?
[in Korean] Why is that delay so strong right now?
Can you bring it down a bit?
Push it forward a bit.
[in English] I'm their producer, songwriter.
translation.zh: ‎我是她们的制作人 歌曲作者

translation.en: I've written and produced every single song that's come out so far.
translation.zh:
‎到现在为止出的所有歌都是我写的
‎都是我制作的

translation.en: It's been about four years now.
Our initial approach was more like… single, smash, single, hit.
translation.zh:
‎我们起初的方法更像是
‎单曲 走红 单曲 大卖

translation.en: Now, we feel like we need to tell more of our personal story.
translation.zh:
‎现在 我们觉得需要
‎更多地诉说我们自己的故事

translation.en: And I know the fans are mad. Like, "We want more and more."
translation.zh:
‎我知道粉丝们很生气
‎会说：“我们要更多的歌”

translation.en: We do have a lot in here, but…
we're very particular with what we put out.
translation.zh: ‎但是要推出哪些歌 我们是很挑的

translation.en: [Rosé and Jennie in Korean] Hello!
[Jennie in English] Oppa, you got some leather jackets going on there?
[in Korean] Awesome!
[in English] Stop acting like I overdressed today.
translation.zh: ‎别装得好像我今天穿过头了 好吗？

translation.en: I always dress like this.
[in Korean] I should've had a nap today.
-I'll slap your wrist. Sleepy right? -I didn't get a nap.
translation.zh: ‎我打一下你手心 还困吗？

translation.en: Better?
[Teddy in English] So, I have the…
Lady Gaga featuring BLACKPINK that's about to come out.
translation.zh: ‎嘎嘎小姐风格的BLACKPINK ‎马上就要推出

translation.en: We worked hard before New Year's for this.
translation.zh: ‎我们在新年之前为这个练得很辛苦

translation.en: [Teddy] They're huge, and they're so successful.
I don't think any of us even expected this.
Sometimes it gets to me, like, "Oh, my God."
How do we live up to this hype?
translation.zh: ‎我们怎么才配得上这样的宣传啊？

translation.en: Sour candy. [laughs]
-[exclaims] -[Jisoo in Korean] It's addictive.
[Teddy in Korean] Should we re-record certain parts of "Crazy Over You"?
translation.zh:
‎《疯狂地爱你》中的一些部分
‎要不要重录？

translation.en: [Teddy in English] Every group has their own different cultural background
translation.zh:
‎每一个团体
‎都有自己不同的文化背景

translation.en: that makes them who they are.
[Teddy] But the combination, that's what makes BLACKPINK unique
translation.zh: ‎但是这种组合 使BLACKPINK独一无二

translation.en: and stand out.
[in Korean] Who thinks they can nail their part in this song?
translation.zh:
‎谁觉得自己
‎可以搞定这首歌中自己那部分？

translation.en: [in English] Rosé, want to go in first for the intro?
[Teddy] Rosé, a Korean girl that was raised in Australia.
translation.zh: ‎彩英 一个在新西兰长大的韩国姑娘

translation.en: And she stays here 'til, like, six o'clock a.m. just in the studio.
translation.zh: ‎她会在工作室待到早上六点

translation.en: Sometimes I'm like, "Wow! You still here?"
translation.zh: ‎有时我会说：“哇！你还在这里啊？”

translation.en: [in English] Ooh… you really killed that one.
[Teddy] Jisoo. Straight-up Korean girl that grew up in Korea.
translation.zh: ‎智秀 率直的韩国姑娘 在韩国长大

translation.en: She's the unnie of the group. She's the oldest.
translation.zh: ‎她是团里的大姐 她年纪最大

translation.en: [Teddy] She does have that professional poker face.
translation.zh: ‎她确实有一副严肃的职业面孔

translation.en: I've known Jisoo for, let's say, a good six years.
I've seen her cry…
once.
She's super smart.
A lot of people might think she's book smart,
translation.zh: ‎很多人可能会说她读书聪明

translation.en: but I would say she's street smart.
-[rattling] -[in Korean] Oh, that scared me.
[Teddy in English] Lisa, from Thailand.
She's always got that cool, calm,
translation.zh: ‎她总是有很酷、很冷静的微笑

translation.en: "it's gonna be okay, we're all good" smile.
translation.zh: ‎让大家觉得没事 我们都很好

translation.en: [Teddy] But when it comes to certain moments,
when the music starts, when it's crunch time,
translation.zh: ‎当音乐响起 压力巨大的时候

translation.en: she has this executioner killer instinct.
[Teddy in English] Jennie, born in Korea, but moved to New Zealand.
translation.zh: ‎珍妮 出生在韩国 但是搬去了新西兰

translation.en: She's super clear.
Her opinions, her emotions.
She's a perfectionist.
[Teddy] All those different cultures in one pot,
translation.zh: ‎这么多不同的文化融汇在一起

translation.en: it's just different how they walk, how they talk, and how they dress.
translation.zh: ‎她们走路、说话、穿衣都不一样

translation.en: And the perfect balance, how they complement each other.
translation.zh: ‎她们互相赞美 完美平衡

translation.en: It's fascinating.
[Teddy] We're just Korean people trying to do music,
translation.zh:
‎我们就是一群韩国人
‎努力地在做音乐

translation.en: so if Korean people make music, it's K-pop? I don't even get it. Like…
translation.zh:
‎所以如果韩国人做音乐
‎就是韩国流行音乐？我搞不懂

translation.en: It's Korean pop.
The only thing is language.
Why don't they do that for every country?
translation.zh: ‎为什么不为每个国家去做呢？

translation.en: What is K-pop?
-[static] -K-pop.
[reporter 1] K-pop is taking the US by storm.
K-pop has become a worldwide cultural phenomenon.
translation.zh:
‎韩国流行音乐
‎已成为世界范围的文化现象

translation.en: The genre has been around for at least two decades.
translation.zh: ‎这个类型已经存在了至少二十年

translation.en: [in Korean] This is a three-member group named Seo Taiji and Boys.
translation.zh:
‎这是一个三人组合
‎名叫徐太志和孩子们

translation.en: Please welcome them.
[reporter 2 in Korean] Powerful rhythm and flash dances are the hallmarks of Seo Taiji's music.
translation.zh:
‎有力的节奏和闪亮的舞蹈
‎是徐太志音乐的印记

translation.en: They sing well, look cool, and dance well.
translation.zh: ‎他们唱得好 样子酷 舞跳得也好

translation.en: The interest in Korean pop music is unusually high from foreigners.
translation.zh:
‎外国人对韩国流行音乐的兴趣
‎异常高昂

translation.en: [reporter 3 in English] A few big music agencies
began making these polished groups of singers, rappers, and dancers.
translation.zh:
‎开始打造这些由歌手
‎说唱歌手和舞者组成的光鲜组合

translation.en: [reporter 4] One of the heavy-weight companies is YG Entertainment.
translation.zh: ‎业内的一个重量级公司是YG娱乐

translation.en: [reporter 5] …responsible for the insanely viral "Gangnam Style."
translation.zh: ‎爆火的《江南范儿》就是他们的作品

translation.en: [reporter 5 in English] The industry brings in billions of dollars a year.
translation.zh: ‎这个行业每年进账数以十亿美元计

translation.en: [reporter 6] Grooming these singers is an industry all in itself.
[reporter 7] Trainees can start as young as 11 years old.
[reporter 8] They're raised together. They train together.
[reporter 9] Perfecting every pitch. Mastering every move.
translation.zh: ‎完善每一个音高 掌握每一个动作

translation.en: [reporter 7] Stakes are high.  Some make their debut after just a few months' training.
translation.zh:
‎风险很大
‎有的人仅训练几个月就出道了

translation.en: For others, it could be up to a decade.
Many never make it to debut at all.
[Jennie in English] Preparing for a new album, that's definitely fun,
translation.zh: ‎为一张新专辑作准备 这绝对很有趣

translation.en: 'cause it's like trying to come up with something new,
translation.zh: ‎因为这就像要想出新的东西

translation.en: but fittings like this,
it is one of the biggest, like, creative parts that we do.
translation.zh: ‎是我们最有创新的部分之一

translation.en: [Jennie in Korean] You look naturally sexy!
-Really! -You can't help yourself!
[Rosé] If we wear something, we all try to see how it fits as a group,
translation.zh:
‎我们穿戴的时候
‎会考虑作为一个整体是否合适

translation.en: but that's-- Well, it's case by case.
translation.zh: ‎但这是要具体问题具体分析

translation.en: [in English] It takes a long time.
[in Korean] Shouldn't we make it a bit tighter? What do you think?
translation.zh:
‎不过咱们是不是应该弄紧一点？
‎你觉得呢？

translation.en: -Because this side goes up. -[woman] Mm-mm-mm.
[in English] Okay.
[Jennie] Lisa! Lalisa!
[Jennie in Korean] Lisa has diverse tastes.
-[in English] She can wear whatever. -She pulls off anything.
translation.zh:
‎-她想穿什么就穿什么
‎-对 她穿什么都没问题

translation.en: [Rosé] It's so hard to define style.
I don't think there's any, like, boundaries within that.
We don't go, "This is Korean, and this is Western. This is Asian."
translation.zh:
‎我们不会说：“这是韩式的
‎这是西式的 这是亚洲的”

translation.en: I think fashion is really just international.
The more that there aren't any boundaries, I think that's when you can get creative.
translation.zh:
‎我觉得 越是没有界限
‎你越能发挥创意

translation.en: And since we do crazy choreography on stage,
translation.zh: ‎因为我们在舞台上的编舞非常疯狂

translation.en: it all has to be really engineered, basically.
Make sure nothing flops out anywhere.
-[Rosé] Yeah. -[laughs]
-[in Korean] What's this? -Coachella.
[Jennie] I missed my note at the "eh."
See, this is why we can't watch our old footage.
translation.zh: ‎看吧 所以说咱们不能看以前的视频

translation.en: We're like, "You missed your note at the 'eh',"
and, "I should've gone slower at this part of the choreography,
translation.zh: ‎你跳舞的时候 应该这样做

translation.en: but I did it too quickly."
translation.zh:
‎-但是你做得太快了”
‎-我走调了

translation.en: I missed my note. That wasn't good.
translation.zh:
‎-但是你做得太快了”
‎-我走调了 ‎不行

translation.en: We were so nervous…
[in English] Yeah. If anything, it's stressful.
Sometimes if something's not working, or I'm not doing my best performance,
translation.zh:
‎有时候如果有的方面不行
‎或者我的表现不是最好

translation.en: it can be stressful.
[Jisoo in Korean] Compared to other stages,
translation.zh:
‎和其他舞台相比
‎这里的压力要大得多

translation.en: it was much more overwhelming because we were so nervous.
translation.zh:
‎和其他舞台相比
‎这里的压力要大得多 ‎因为我们非常紧张

translation.en: [Jennie] For us, it was our first time in a country we weren't familiar with.
translation.zh:
‎对我们来说 ‎这是我们第一次
‎在美国这个不熟悉的地方表演

translation.en: I used to dream of that day when we were trainees.
translation.zh:
‎我们做练习生的时候
‎我会梦想这一天

translation.en: -This is it. -This is it.
I always avoid interviews or any questions about me
translation.zh:
‎我总是避免访问
‎避免关于我们的问题

translation.en: because I would rather not talk about myself, but…
translation.zh: ‎因为我宁愿不要谈我自己 但是…

translation.en: [woman in Korean] Jennie's personality?
At first, it was hard getting to know her,
translation.zh: ‎起初 要了解她不容易 ‎但是一旦熟悉了之后

translation.en: but once we became close,
I could tell that she's very loyal, very sweet, and a lovely friend.
translation.zh:
‎我能看出她非常忠诚
‎人很好 是一个很可爱的朋友

translation.en: I see her every day, so I'm used to her, and she's like my little sister.
translation.zh:
‎我每天都和她见面 习惯了
‎她就像我妹妹一样

translation.en: But when I see her on TV, I'm like, "Ah, Jennie is a star,”
translation.zh:
‎但是当我在电视上看到她的时候
‎我会觉得：“啊！珍妮是明星！”

translation.en: but she's really down-to-earth.
-[Jennie breathes deeply] -[Jessie] You're doing so well.
[Jennie in English] She's my friend. One of few that I have.
translation.zh: ‎她是我的朋友 我的朋友并不多

translation.en: -[groans] -[in Korean] Slowly. [chuckles]
We're going to lift one leg up and do an arabesque.
translation.zh:
‎我们要把一条腿抬起来
‎摆出阿拉贝斯舞姿

translation.en: [in English] I'm always aching after tours and stuff.
translation.zh: ‎巡回演出之后 我总会觉得疼

translation.en: I feel like, out of all the members, I'm always sick. [laughs]
translation.zh: ‎我觉得在所有团员中 我总是生病

translation.en: You know, some days, just like every other human being,
translation.zh: ‎在有的日子里 就像其他所有人一样

translation.en: you feel extra happy.
And some other days, you're feeling down.
translation.zh: ‎而有的日子里 你会觉得感到低落

translation.en: Singing, dancing, and rapping, I always enjoy it all the time,
translation.zh: ‎唱歌 跳舞 说唱 我总是很喜欢

translation.en: but we always have to be on stage
looking perfect and performing the same thing.
translation.zh:
‎显出非常完美的样子
‎表演相同的内容

translation.en: It's like working out for two hours every day.
It never gets easy.
Gets harder, actually, 'cause you age. [laughs]
translation.zh: ‎其实会变得更辛苦 因为年龄会增大

translation.en: I was born in Korea.
It's just me and my mom. I'm the only child.
translation.zh: ‎只有我和妈妈 我是唯一的孩子

translation.en: I was raised in Seoul until I was ten.
I went to Australia and New Zealand to travel with my mom,
translation.zh: ‎我陪妈妈一起去了澳大利亚和新西兰

translation.en: and by the time we got to New Zealand,
it was so nice and peaceful.
She asked me, "How do you feel about living here?"
translation.zh:
‎她问我：“你觉得
‎在这里生活怎么样？”

translation.en: And I said, "Yeah, I would like that."
So, from ten to 15, I was in New Zealand by myself.
translation.zh:
‎所以从十岁到十五岁
‎我自己待在新西兰

translation.en: I never really got to spend so much time in the house with my mom…
translation.zh: ‎我从没有真正和我妈一起在家很久

translation.en: until recently.
[Jennie] I did a homestay.
I got to just run around, learn so many things.
translation.zh: ‎我能到处跑 学了很多东西

translation.en: [young Jennie in Korean] I understand English better than when I began.
translation.zh: ‎我的英文比一开始的时候更好了

translation.en: In the beginning, my friends helped me a lot
translation.zh: ‎开始的时候 我的朋友们帮了我很多

translation.en: and showed me their notes. Now I can do it by myself.
translation.zh: ‎让我看他们的笔记 ‎我现在可以自己做笔记了

translation.en: [Jennie in English] They have classes in school to go out,
go camping, go learn instruments. If you want, do art.
translation.zh:
‎去露营、学乐器、做艺术
‎如果你想参加的话

translation.en: Everything was up to you.
Even if you're ten, you still got to make your own decisions.
translation.zh: ‎即便你十岁 你还是可以自己作决定

translation.en: That was very important for me to have at a young age.
That built me as who I am right now.
translation.zh: ‎这把我塑造成了我现在的样子

translation.en: I am super shy.
I was one of those people where I can't even order something on the phone.
translation.zh: ‎我属于那种连用电话点单都不敢的人

translation.en: Like, I hated that.
[Jennie in English] Took me a while to get this far.
translation.zh: ‎我花了一段时间在走到现在这一步

translation.en: [Jennie] When I turned 15, I was deciding whether I should move to America.
translation.zh:
‎当我15岁的时候
‎我要决定是否搬去美国

translation.en: I went there, I checked the school out. Everything was kind of decided, like 80%.
translation.zh:
‎我去了美国 看了一下学校
‎一切都差不多决定好了 80%吧

translation.en: And I came back to New Zealand to pack my stuff up,
translation.zh: ‎然后我回了新西兰收拾东西

translation.en: and that's when I realized I don't want to go to America
translation.zh: ‎这时我意识到 ‎我不想去美国 再去自己一个人学习

translation.en: and do another study there by myself.
translation.zh: ‎我不想去美国 再去自己一个人学习

translation.en: I actually want to become a singer. I don't know where it came from.
translation.zh:
‎我居然想当歌手了
‎我也不知道这想法是哪儿来的

translation.en: [Jennie] As soon as I came back, I did an audition. And luckily, I got in right away.
translation.zh:
‎我一回来 就参加了一次试镜
‎很幸运 我马上就被选上了

translation.en: I was like, "Wow! These people are so in to it!"
"They know what they're doing." I was like, "Let's catch up."
translation.zh: ‎他们很厉害 要迎头赶上啊”

translation.en: That's all I had in mind.
♪ I only call you When it's half past five ♪ ♪ The only time that I can call you… ♪
[Lisa in Korean] So pretty!
[Jennie in Korean] Oh, that’s really long ago.
I used to do a lot of dark and strong songs.
translation.zh: ‎我以前唱很多黑暗而强烈的歌

translation.en: So I often wonder, "What am I doing right now?"
translation.zh: ‎所以我经常会想：“我现在在干嘛？”

translation.en: It's so different from what I do now. [chuckles]
-[Lisa] Your gestures! -[Rosé] You're always so cool.
[Jennie in English] It's sad to say, the very first group of people that trained with me,
translation.zh:
‎说起来挺难过的
‎和我一起受训的第一批人

translation.en: none of them are here with me right now.
translation.zh: ‎现在没有一个和我一起在这里

translation.en: And as soon as Lisa came in, that's when I thought…
translation.zh: ‎当拉莉莎加入的时候 我心想

translation.en: [in Korean] "Wow, there are people born to do this."
translation.zh: ‎“哇 有的人是天生干这个的”

translation.en: [Lisa in Korean] My role… I'm a rapper and also the lead dancer.
translation.zh: ‎我的角色是说唱歌手 也是领舞

translation.en: Hello.
[in English] Oh, this is cute.
[in Korean] I love vintage clothes.
So wherever I go, whether it be America or anywhere else,
translation.zh:
‎所以不论我去哪里
‎不论是美国还是其他地方

translation.en: I try to look for vintage shops.
[in English] Oh, wow. Voilà!
[in Korean] This is 1.1 million.
-And this is 320,000. -And this one?
This is 1.1 million?
Yes, because it's from the early '90s.
[in English] This is so cool!
Can I-- Can I get this? [chuckles]
[in Korean] My mom manages my finances.
[in English] She's gonna be like, "No, Lisa, no. Stop shopping for now."
translation.zh: ‎她会说：“不行 拉莉莎 先别买了”

translation.en: She's always like that, but I don't really listen to her.
translation.zh: ‎她总是这样 不过我其实不听她的

translation.en: I'm sorry, Mom. [giggles]
When I was born.
[Lisa in Korean] I was born in Thailand.
[in Thai] I was born in Buriram Province.
Then I moved to Bangkok when I was three.
My auntie had a music group,
so they had mic stands, and I always played with them.
translation.zh:
‎所以他们有麦克风架
‎我总会和他们一起玩

translation.en: I would lower it until it was the same height as me.
translation.zh:
‎我会把架子放低
‎直到我长到和架子一样高

translation.en: Then I would just dance and sing to myself.
translation.zh: ‎然后我会跳舞和唱歌 只给我自己看

translation.en: That was how my mom knew I loved dancing.
translation.zh: ‎我妈就是这样知道我很喜欢跳舞

translation.en: So she signed me up for a course when I was in kindergarten.
translation.zh:
‎于是 我在幼儿园的时候
‎她就给我报课程

translation.en: [Lisa] That was how it all began.
[Lisa] She signed me up to many contests…
[in English] …dance competition and stuff.
[in Thai] How long have you been practicing break dancing?
For a long time.
[Lisa] I participated in a contest. I was around 12 or 13 years old then.
translation.zh:
‎我参加了一个比赛
‎当时我大概十二三岁

translation.en: Then a talent scout told me to try singing and asked if I wanted to be a singer.
translation.zh:
‎然后一个星探让我尝试唱歌
‎问我想不想做歌手

translation.en: Then I realized that I loved both singing and dancing.
translation.zh:
‎然后我发现我既喜欢跳舞
‎也喜欢唱歌

translation.en: And YG happened to have an audition at the time.
So, I made a decision.
[in English] Okay. I should try, for sure.
[Jennie in Korean] Is this an audition?
[Jisoo] How many layers are you wearing? Why are you wearing pants on top too?
translation.zh:
‎你穿了多少件啊？
‎你为什么裤子外面还要穿裤子？

translation.en: -What is this? -[Rosé] Oh, wow!
-Oh, my God. -[Rosé] This is amazing. Wow!
You look so cool. [Lisa] I'm trying so hard to be cool.
translation.zh:
‎-你看起来好酷啊！
‎-我在很努力地要酷一点

translation.en: [in Thai] After the audition ended… [in Korean] …I waited for the call.
I was waiting and waiting. [in Thai] I waited for the call.
I waited for two months!
And then they called me. I was like, "What? Is this possible?"
translation.zh:
‎然后他们给我打电话
‎我心想：“啊？真的吗？”

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] I was a mama's girl.
So, when I had to go to Korea without Mom,
translation.zh: ‎所以当我要离开妈妈去韩国时

translation.en: I felt that I had to take care of myself now.
translation.zh: ‎我感觉到 现在我得自己照顾自己了

translation.en: [in English] I was 14.
Such a kid.
[in Korean] I didn't speak any Korean.
I only knew how to say "hello," so it really was a new start.
translation.zh:
‎我当时只会说“你好”
‎所以确实是一个新的开始

translation.en: [in English] ♪ I'm in the club High off purp', with some shades on… ♪
[Lisa in Korean] Fortunately, there was Jennie.
[Lisa in Korean] She was the only one who could speak English among the trainees.
translation.zh: ‎她是当时练习生中唯一会说英语的

translation.en: I spoke English with her…
[in Korean] …and if something were to happen, I would talk to her.
translation.zh: ‎如果有什么事 我会和她说

translation.en: [Jisoo in Korean] That's it.
[in English] However you feel comfortable. Like…
[in Korean] You choose how to sing it because we're all doing it differently.
translation.zh:
‎你选择怎么去唱
‎因为我们在都用不同的方法去唱

translation.en: -[Teddy] There you go. -Okay.
[Jisoo in Korean] A great thing with us
is everyone wants the best for the group as a whole.
translation.zh: ‎每一个人都想为集体好 为组合好

translation.en: [Teddy] That's cool. I'm happy with that.
[Lisa in Korean] Okay.
[Jisoo] Since we perform as a group,
translation.zh: ‎既然我们是作为一个组合来表演

translation.en: we try to strike a balance that works for everyone.
translation.zh:
‎我们就要尽量达到
‎大家都能接受的平衡

translation.en: I think.
[Jisoo] What's up? What's up?
[woman in Korean] Sit here, Jisoo.
[Jisoo] What do you think?
Do you think I'll be able to learn today?
I think it’ll be nice to learn how to draw my eyebrows properly.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得如果学会怎么给我自己画眉毛 ‎那就太好了 ‎（李明善 化妆师）

translation.en: If you show me, I'll follow it.
translation.zh: ‎如果你画给我看 我会照着学

translation.en: -Okay. -I'm learning from you today.
Do you teach makeup like this too?
-[Myungsun] To regular people? Yes. -Really?
-There are classes for that? -Of course!
I should've taken those classes then. [chuckles]
There are people who come to learn BLACKPINK makeup.
-BLACKPINK makeup? -Yes.
[Jisoo] When I was younger,
my relatives treated me like an outcast because I was ugly.
translation.zh:
‎我的亲戚们把我当外人
‎因为我以前很丑

translation.en: What?
[Jisoo] They called me a monkey.
It's okay. You're the prettiest one now.
translation.zh: ‎没事 你现在是最漂亮的了

translation.en: [Jisoo] I grew up in Sanbon in Gunpo city, Gyeonggi-do region.
translation.zh: ‎我在京畿道军浦市山本洞长大

translation.en: I lived with my parents,  my sister, my brother, and my grandparents.
translation.zh:
‎和我父母、兄弟姐妹
‎还有爷爷奶奶一起生活

translation.en: I'm living a very different life
than the one I thought I'd be living.
I used to want to be a writer or a painter.
translation.zh: ‎我曾想要做一个作家或者画家

translation.en: Although, I couldn't paint well.
And then I joined the drama club in 11th grade.
translation.zh:
‎后来 我在11年级的时候
‎加入了戏剧俱乐部

translation.en: Should I try acting?
They were saying I should start auditioning for stuff
because I needed the experience.
[Jisoo] My first audition was at YG.
I didn't know much at all about YG before I arrived there the first day.
translation.zh: ‎在我来之前 不太了解YG娱乐

translation.en: It felt like something far removed from me.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得好像是离我很遥远的东西

translation.en: I never thought I'd actually be doing it for real.
translation.zh: ‎我从没想到会真的做这一行

translation.en: How about now? Do you think I really lost my baby fat?
translation.zh:
‎现在呢？
‎你真的觉得我没有婴儿肥了吗？

translation.en: Back then, it was more baby-like here…
translation.zh: ‎之前 这里会有些婴儿肥

translation.en: I guess I'll just have to eat ramen before I sleep tonight. [chuckles]
translation.zh: ‎今天睡觉之前 我大概只能吃拉面了

translation.en: Maybe then you'll get your old self back.
translation.zh: ‎这样你也许能找回以前的自己

translation.en: No, you're perfect right now.
translation.zh: ‎不过不行 你现在漂亮了

translation.en: Anyways, you were like a baby back then.
But you're different from back then, too.
-[laughs] -You have your own shop!
Who told you to open your own shop?
Say it! Who told you to?
You did.
It was my big plan.
And I'm still planning big things.
I think that there are very few who truly think,
translation.zh: ‎我觉得很少有人会这的这么想

translation.en: "This is what I have to do. This is my path."
translation.zh: ‎“我必须做现在的事 这是我的路”

translation.en: People like that are really lucky.
translation.zh: ‎在我看来 这样的人很幸运

translation.en: I don't think there are many like that.
[Rosé in English] I have a really hard time falling asleep.
I have a lot of thoughts running through my head.
And singing is kind of like stress relief,
and everything just kind of makes sense when I'm doing this.
translation.zh: ‎我唱歌的时候 一切似乎就都想通了

translation.en: I didn't think I could ever perfect that one. [laughs]
translation.zh: ‎我觉得我不可能把这首歌唱完美了

translation.en: Sometimes, I actually have missed my trainee days.
translation.zh: ‎有时候 ‎我其实会想念我做练习生时的日子

translation.en: Because, back then, we were surrounded by music all the time.
translation.zh:
‎因为 在那个时候
‎我们整天都被音乐围绕

translation.en: But these days we've got a lot of work, so I actually have to make time for this.
translation.zh:
‎但现在 我们有很多工作
‎所以我其实得挤时间来练歌

translation.en: That's why it's always at night, when I'm supposed to be sleeping.
translation.zh:
‎所以总是在夜里
‎夜里本来是该睡觉的

translation.en: Hi, girls and boys.
I'm called Roseanne…
and I just woke up.
And welcome to Pajama News.
[Rosé] I was born in New Zealand.
And then I moved to Australia when I was eight.
translation.zh: ‎然后我八岁时搬去了澳大利亚

translation.en: Back then, I was always on the piano.
I'd like sit there, and I'd play this lullaby for myself,
translation.zh: ‎我会坐在那里 给自己弹摇篮曲

translation.en: but I'd be really sleepy, and I'd fall asleep,
translation.zh: ‎但是我会非常困 快睡着的样子

translation.en: and then I'd put my chin on my knee.
translation.zh: ‎然后我会把下巴搁在膝盖上

translation.en: I went to church every Sunday and had a lot of Korean friends there.
translation.zh:
‎我以前每周日去教堂
‎那里有很多韩国朋友

translation.en: But then at school, I was just a normal Australian kid.
translation.zh:
‎但是在学校里
‎我就是一个普通的澳大利亚小孩

translation.en: -[man] Congratulations, Rosé. -[audience clapping]
[Rosé] And I think I enjoyed having two lives.
translation.zh: ‎我想我当时很享受两种生活

translation.en: Kind of like Hannah Montana. [laughs]
It's funny.
[Rosé] My dad saw on the news that YG was coming to Australia.
translation.zh:
‎我爸在新闻里看到
‎YG娱乐要来澳大利亚

translation.en: He was like, "Rosé, do you wanna audition?"
translation.zh: ‎他说：“彩英 你想去试镜吗？”

translation.en: And I was so shocked.
I think I asked him, "Do I like music? Do I?"
translation.zh:
‎我想我问他说：“我喜欢音乐吗？
‎喜欢吗？”

translation.en: And he's like, "Yeah, obviously."
"You're gonna have to, you know, try do something about it."
"Otherwise you're gonna be 25,
and you're gonna regret that you didn't try anything."
[Rosé] I was 16.
Then I went and auditioned, and then they called me,
translation.zh: ‎然后我去试镜 之后他们给我打电话

translation.en: and they were like, "Can you fly to Korea within two months?"
translation.zh:
‎他们说：“你能在两个月内
‎飞来韩国吗？”

translation.en: [Rosé] And then my whole life changed.
translation.zh: ‎然后 我的整个人生就改变了

translation.en: I dropped out of school.
In Australia, I dropped out of school.
translation.zh: ‎在澳大利亚 我从学校退学

translation.en: I had never even imagined myself living apart from my family.
translation.zh:
‎我之前从没想过
‎自己会离开家人去生活

translation.en: I hadn't even slept more than two weeks out of home.
translation.zh: ‎我甚至没有在外面住超过两个月

translation.en: It was a really-- Oh, my gosh. I'm gonna cry.
I'm gonna cry.
Yeah.
The first night in the dorm,
they were all in the same room.
Everybody was sleeping.
[in Korean] She brought a guitar from Australia, and I was like,
translation.zh: ‎她从澳大利亚带来一把吉他 ‎我说：“给我们弹首曲子”

translation.en: "Play something for us." [laughs]
[in English] It was us four. I don't even know why,
translation.zh:
‎当时就是我们四个
‎我都不知道为什么

translation.en: but it was us four.
We covered songs 'til morning.
All four of us, we were singing. Somebody was harmonizing.
translation.zh:
‎我们四个人 一直在唱歌
‎有人唱和声

translation.en: I think Jisoo was harmonizing.
It was so funny. Can you believe it?
-[Rosé laughs] -My eyes.
[Rosé] My eyes.
-[in Korean] It's really pretty. -[Lisa] Wow!
Here, stand here.
[in English] One, two…
-Nice. -I wanna have a look.
[Lisa in Korean] After my Korean classes on the fifth floor,
I took the elevators to the basement.
And there was this girl
with short hair, tied back.
It was kind of awkward.
-I was nervous. -I'm sure you were nervous.
translation.zh:
‎-我当时很紧张
‎-你当时肯定很紧张

translation.en: [in English] So weird. [in Korean] I was like, "Oh! A new girl?"
-[Rosé laughs] -I was like… so wary of competition.
translation.zh:
‎-我当时很害怕竞争
‎-对 害怕竞争

translation.en: -[in Korean] Right. Competition. -Competition, it's so competitive.
translation.zh:
‎-我当时很害怕竞争
‎-对 害怕竞争 ‎很害怕竞争

translation.en: [in English] Everything was gyeongjaeng at that time.
She thought I was competition, and I was just really intimidated.
translation.zh:
‎她当时觉得我是竞争对手
‎我非常害怕

translation.en: Like, everybody is so good.
[Lisa in Thai] We were the same age,
and we had similar tastes.
[in Korean] Since we both came from another country,
translation.zh: ‎因为我们都从外国来 ‎所以当我们有困难时

translation.en: we relied on each other when we were having a hard time.
[in Thai] We become like two peas in a pod.
We were like genuine twins.
[Rosé in English] We have so many days where we walk out, and we're wearing the same thing.
translation.zh: ‎很多时候我们出去 穿同样的衣服

translation.en: [in Korean] And during our days off, we'd always be together.
translation.zh: ‎放假的时候 我们总会在一起

translation.en: [in English] She started getting an Australian accent.
See, she still has it sometimes.
[in Australian accent] No.
-Yeah. -No.
[giggles] I don't even know how to say--
I never knew I would live in Korea.
translation.zh: ‎我从没想到自己会在韩国生活

translation.en: Then all of a sudden at 16, I'm like… Now Korea is my home.
translation.zh:
‎突然 在16岁的时候
‎我心想：“现在韩国是我的家了”

translation.en: [Lisa in Korean] Was it hard for you? [in English] Of course.
Even though you have me?
You?
You're not any help.
I'm joking. [giggles]
-Yeah, 'cause I grew up with a sister. -Mm.
translation.zh: ‎嗯 ‎因为我从小长大有一个姐妹

translation.en: Think about not having a sister.
But Lisa was there.
[in Korean] When I was having a hard time, I'd look at Rosé, and she'd be the same.
translation.zh:
‎当我很难受的时候
‎我会看看彩英 她也一样

translation.en: [in English] I thought I was really sad, but I'd look at you, and I'd go, "Okay."
translation.zh:
‎我当时以为自己很惨
‎但我看看你 心里就平衡了

translation.en: I think what makes K-pop K-pop is the time that we spend as a trainee.
translation.zh:
‎我想韩国流行音乐
‎之所以能成为韩国流行音乐 ‎是因为我们作为练习生所花的时间

translation.en: We all live together, sort of like a boarding school,
translation.zh: ‎（受训六年、五年、四年、五年） ‎我们都住在一起 有点像寄宿学校

translation.en: like a training version.
[Rosé] I think there were nine girls.
They were planning on creating a big group,
translation.zh: ‎他们当时计划做一个大组合

translation.en: so they had a lot of girls there.
[Jennie] They need you to be at their standard in every single subject.
translation.zh: ‎她们需要在每一科都达到标准

translation.en: [in Korean] For me, there were so many lessons in the beginning.
I took three to four dancing lessons a day and practiced.
translation.zh: ‎我每天上三四节舞蹈课 还要练习

translation.en: I had vocal lessons from two to three teachers.
It was a rough time.
[Rosé in English] We'd get a day off every fortnight,
and then practice again for another 13 days.
So 14 hours a day just training. [chuckles]
[Teddy] It's not easy,
the repetition.
But at such a young age, they are able to absorb all the techniques and the tools
translation.zh:
‎但是在这么小的年龄时
‎他们能够吸收所有技巧和工具

translation.en: that they need for their next ten years.
translation.zh:
‎这些东西
‎在他们未来的十年是需要的

translation.en: [Rosé] There's this basic routine you have to learn in dancing.
translation.zh:
‎在舞蹈中
‎有一些基本的常规动作要学

translation.en: Jennie was like, "The first thing you have to learn is that,
and I'll just teach you the first moves."
translation.zh: ‎我会教你最先要学的一些动作”

translation.en: And she was like, "Do this." And I was like, "I don't know how."
translation.zh:
‎她说：“这样做”
‎我说：“我不知道怎么做”

translation.en: [Lisa] I can still remember the first day that you had a dance lesson.
translation.zh: ‎我还记得你第一天上舞蹈课的样子

translation.en: -[laughs] -'Cause I'd never danced in my life.
It was cute.
If you ask a 16-year-old to dance for the first time,
translation.zh: ‎如果你让一个16岁的孩子第一次跳舞

translation.en: it's the funniest thing. I looked like a…
translation.zh: ‎那是最搞笑的 我就想一个…

translation.en: And then after that, I got so angry at myself.
translation.zh: ‎之后 我非常生我自己的气

translation.en: I was like, "I am going to become like Lisa."
translation.zh: ‎我心想：“我要变成像拉莉莎那样”

translation.en: 'Cause Lisa was the dancer. She was like… She was at the top.
translation.zh:
‎因为拉莉莎跳舞非常好
‎当时是跳得最好的

translation.en: [Rosé] At the end of every month, our boss and all the producers would come,
translation.zh:
‎每个月月底
‎我们的老板和所有制作人会来

translation.en: and we'd perform a solo song, a group song, and a group choreography.
translation.zh:
‎我们会表演一首独唱
‎一首合唱、一支团体舞

translation.en: [Lisa in Korean] For that, we'd have to plan everything ourselves,
translation.zh: ‎为了这个 我们得自己安排好一切

translation.en: but we each had a role.
translation.zh: ‎但我们每个人只有一个角色

translation.en: If someone was in charge of vocals, we'd give them that role,
translation.zh:
‎如果谁负责唱歌
‎我们就会把这个角色给她

translation.en: but I always took on the role of the dancer.
translation.zh: ‎但是我总是拿跳舞这个角色

translation.en: So I'd always design the choreography.
Every month! Literally every month
for five years.
[Lisa] After a monthly review, you would be graded.
translation.zh: ‎每次月度考察之后 就会给你打分

translation.en: You had those who got an A, those with Bs and those with Cs.
[Jennie in English] I remember having to send a good friend of mine home every month
translation.zh: ‎我记得每个月都要送一个好朋友回家

translation.en: because they got eliminated from the test.
translation.zh: ‎因为他们在测试中被淘汰了

translation.en: There were so many rules, so many things to just be like,
"Okay, they don't like this. They don't like that."
translation.zh: ‎他们这也看不惯 那也看不惯

translation.en: Everything that I did was wrong.
[Jennie] Being told that I'm not good at stuff face-to-face
and trying to keep everything together when I hear those things…
translation.zh: ‎听到这些话的时候 我还是要坚持住

translation.en: It's really harsh.
It wasn't a very happy vibe.
We're not allowed to drink, or smoke, or get a tattoo.
[in Korean] I rarely went home and had to practice on the weekends.
translation.zh: ‎我当时很少回家 ‎周末也要练习

translation.en: So my parents were quite upset and worried.
translation.zh: ‎所以我父母很不高兴 很担心

translation.en: But they're not really…
the protective, overbearing type,
translation.zh: ‎但他们不是那种情感外露的人

translation.en: and they knew this was something that I had to do,
translation.zh: ‎他们知道这是我必须做的事

translation.en: so they told me to stay strong and get it done.
translation.zh:
‎所以他们对我说要坚强
‎要把事情做好

translation.en: …and I would always call her and tell her, "Mom, it's so hard."
translation.zh: ‎我总给她打电话说：“妈 好辛苦啊”

translation.en: She'd say, "Come home." I'd say, "No."
My dad sent me, and he was like, "Rosé, come home."
translation.zh:
‎是我爸送我来的
‎他说：“彩英 回家吧”

translation.en: He's like, "We want you back home."
And I hated that. I hated it whenever they would say, "Come home."
translation.zh:
‎我很讨厌这样
‎他们说要我回家 我很讨厌

translation.en: That was the last thing I wanted to hear.
[Jisoo in Korean] I started a bit later than the others,
so I was able to make memories with friends and go to school.
translation.zh: ‎所以我能有和朋友们的回忆 能上学

translation.en: I consider it a blessing now.
[Jennie] I don't regret spending time as a trainee, learning how to dance, how to sing.
translation.zh:
‎我不后悔花时间做练习生
‎学习唱歌跳舞

translation.en: But one thing I wish is to maybe have lived at home
translation.zh: ‎但是我倒是希望 ‎自己能在家生活到十八九岁

translation.en: until I was like 18, 19.
translation.zh: ‎自己能在家生活到十八九岁

translation.en: A lot of people make lots of memories as a high school student.
But I never had that.
[Lisa in Korean] Waiting was the hardest part.
[in Thai] I didn't think I would make it. I was on the verge of letting it go.
translation.zh: ‎我不知道什么时候自己能成功 ‎当时我在放弃的边缘

translation.en: [in English] It was just days on end with just a bunch of girls
translation.zh: ‎一天到晚和一群女孩在一起

translation.en: not knowing where this was going.
[in Korean] I'd ask myself,
"Do you want to give up because it's not easy?"
translation.zh: ‎“你希望因为不容易就放弃吗？”

translation.en: [Jennie in English] I knew I could do it.
The tougher they treated me,
I'm like, "I'm gonna get through it,
and I'm gonna show them that I'm worth it."
translation.zh: ‎我会让他们看到 我是值得的”

translation.en: [Rosé] After all of this, I'm not gonna go back without doing anything.
translation.zh:
‎经历了这么多
‎我不会一事无成地回去

translation.en: That would be embarrassing for me. That's what I thought.
translation.zh:
‎那对我来说太难堪了
‎我当时就是这么想的

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] I had to keep fighting. I had to give it my all.
translation.zh: ‎我必须坚持下去 ‎必须全力以赴

translation.en: "I don't care how long the training will take."
"Bring it on! I don't care about that anymore!"
[Jennie in English] So, the CEO would put us
translation.zh:
‎所以 社长每两个月会把我们
‎放到不同的组合里

translation.en: into different groups every other month just to see.
translation.zh:
‎所以 社长每两个月会把我们
‎放到不同的组合里 ‎就为了看看情况

translation.en: And there was a point where he pointed the four of us out.
translation.zh: ‎有一次他点了我们四个人出来

translation.en: [Jisoo in Korean] We were evaluated together,
and the four of us did screen tests
and recorded demos together.
[Lisa] It happened naturally.
We just clicked.
[Jennie] We just got along so well.
Because usually there's like, "Oh, I wanna sing more."
translation.zh:
‎因为通常会出现这样的情况
‎“噢 我想多唱一点”

translation.en: Or, "Oh, I wanna be in the middle."
There's always those little fights going on in the groups.
translation.zh: ‎在组合里 总会有各种小争斗

translation.en: But when it was the four of us, it was clear what we were doing.
translation.zh: ‎但是我们四个的分工非常明确

translation.en: And that's what made it possible for us to be in a group.
translation.zh: ‎这使我们能够组成一个组合

translation.en: You know, four girls being in one group is not easy.
translation.zh: ‎一个组合里有四个女孩并不容易

translation.en: [Jisoo in Korean] When you're working in a group,
everyone has their place and a role.
translation.zh:
‎我看到每一个人
‎都有自己的位置和角色

translation.en: And when everyone settles into their roles,
translation.zh: ‎每一个人都有机会发光发亮

translation.en: that's how synergy is born.
That realization changed my outlook. When everyone is where they need to be,
translation.zh: ‎实现这一点改变了我的看法 ‎当每个人都在应该在的位置的时候

translation.en: big things can happen.
[Teddy] When I first came in the picture, there were seven, eight, nine girls.
translation.zh:
‎我刚参与的时候
‎有七个、八个还是九个女孩

translation.en: Then we started cutting some songs,
and sonically, whatever that sounded the best.
translation.zh:
‎从声音上来说
‎只要声音效果最好就行

translation.en: The four girls right now, the combination.
translation.zh: ‎现在的四个女孩 这个组合

translation.en: And of course you start looking at their individuality,
translation.zh: ‎当然 你会开始看她们的个性

translation.en: like their character.
The four of them just felt right.
[Lisa in Korean] Teddy felt like a CEO to us.
If somebody did something with Teddy or met with Teddy…
translation.zh:
‎如果有人和洪俊一起做了什么事
‎或者见了洪俊一面

translation.en: [gasps] …it was considered to be a big deal.
[Lisa] I didn't know much about him.
I knew he was a 1TYM member.
[Teddy in English] It's a different time,
and I just wanted to become someone that I needed when I was young.
translation.zh:
‎我当时只是想要成为
‎我年轻时需要的一个人

translation.en: I didn't have somebody that's a little more outside looking in,
translation.zh: ‎我当时没有一个局外的旁观者

translation.en: telling me where to go.
[in Korean] The first time we met was when-- [Jisoo] When I was a trainee.
translation.zh:
‎-我们头一次见面是在我们…
‎-我当时还是练习生

translation.en: [in English] I was so nervous. I couldn't really talk to him.
translation.zh: ‎我当时很紧张 都没办法和他说话

translation.en: [Jisoo in Korean] Meeting you was like the final stage of the debut.
translation.zh: ‎和你见面有点像出道的最后一个步骤

translation.en: You were the final boss. If we meet you, we get to debut. [Lisa] You're right.
translation.zh:
‎你是最终的老大！
‎如果我们和你见面 就能出道了！

translation.en: Oppa, do you remember…
how we had to record that whistling sound 1,000 times?
-[in English] That I'll never forget. -[girls laughing]
I cannot forget that.
And we almost didn't come out with "Whistle" for our debut song, but--
translation.zh: ‎我们差点没用《口哨》作为出道歌曲 ‎但是…

translation.en: [Teddy] Too many people thought it was risky.
But last minute, we were like, "It has to be that one."
translation.zh:
‎但是最后时刻
‎我们觉得一定要是这首歌

translation.en: [Teddy] 'Cause it has this weird country vibe to it, and it's super minimal.
translation.zh:
‎这首歌有奇怪的乡村感觉
‎而且特别细微

translation.en: It just sounded too empty for a lot of people.
translation.zh: ‎对很多人来说听起来太空了

translation.en: Most people were against it. We just pushed forward, whatever.
translation.zh:
‎多数人反对
‎但是我们没管它 就是这样往前推进

translation.en: Hey, you know that photo there?
translation.zh: ‎哎 你们知道那张照片吗？

translation.en: That's our very first photo session as BLACKPINK.
translation.zh:
‎那是我们
‎作为BLACKPINK的头一次照片拍摄

translation.en: [Jennie] Yeah.
It's oppa's favorite photo.
As soon as I saw that photo, how it turned out, I was like,
translation.zh: ‎我一看到那张照片的效果 ‎我心想：“噢 会非常有意思的”

translation.en: "Oh, this is gonna be fun."
translation.zh: ‎我心想：“噢 会非常有意思的”

translation.en: [reporter 1 in Korean] YG Entertainment is expected to showcase its first new girl group in seven years since 2NE1 debuted.
translation.zh:
‎自2NE1出道之后
‎YG娱乐将会推出七年来首个新女团

translation.en: [reporter 2] Under the direction of producer Teddy,
this new group is being prepared.
Its members and debut songs have been shrouded in secrecy.
translation.zh: ‎其成员和出道歌曲被严格保密

translation.en: I'm shaking!
-So shaky! -[staff laughing]
"Various… diverse colors…"
[sighs] How does it go?
[in English] All I wanted was people to see the potential in us.
translation.zh: ‎我当时只希望大家看到我们的潜力

translation.en: It didn't necessarily have to be, "Wow! This group came out,
translation.zh:
‎不用一推出大家就说：“哇！
‎这个组合出来了

translation.en: and they're so perfect in every single way."
Like, I wanted people to be curious about us.
[in Korean] Hello everyone.
I'm BLACKPINK's Rosé.
Hello everyone. I'm BLACKPINK's Jennie.
Hello everyone.
I'm BLACKPINK's Jisoo.
Hello everyone. I'm BLACKPINK's Lisa.
Uh… after training with my members all this time
translation.zh: ‎在和我的成员们一起训练这么久之后

translation.en: and finally being able to debut on this stage,
translation.zh: ‎终于能够在这个舞台上出道

translation.en: I'm nervous and excited.
In the future, we will work hard to show everyone BLACKPINK's unique colors.
translation.zh:
‎未来 我们会努力地向大家展示
‎BLACKPINK的独特色彩

translation.en: Please love us!
[all together] Thank you!
[in English] As soon as we debuted…
[in Korean] …I think it happened just the way I thought it would.
translation.zh: ‎发生的情况应该说和我预想的一样

translation.en: [in English] Let's go!
[all together in Korean] Hello.
I can't wait. Can you tell us who's performing next?
translation.zh: ‎我等不及了 ‎下一个节目谁要来表演呢？

translation.en: Two of their songs debuted exclusively at Inkigayo last week
translation.zh:
‎她们两首歌曲
‎上周在《人气歌谣》独家出道表演

translation.en: and could be number one!
[man] Shall we see the performance of BLACKPINK, the hottest rookies right now?
translation.zh:
‎咱们来看一下当前最热的菜鸟
‎BLACKPINK的表演吧？

translation.en: -Music… -…start!
[reporter 3 in Korean] YG's new girl group, BLACKPINK,
has reached number one only 14 days after their debut,
which is the shortest time ever by a girl group to reach number one.
translation.zh: ‎这是女团登顶的最短时间纪录

translation.en: [Jisoo] I remember making our debut and winning awards.
translation.zh: ‎我记得我们出道和得奖时的情况

translation.en: [in English] Wow!
[in Korean] And feeling like, "Wow! We did it."
[Jisoo] "Whistle" kept going up and up, and when it hit number one,
translation.zh: ‎《口哨》不断往上走 ‎当上到排名第一的时候

translation.en: we were just so happy and excited.
[Jennie] Honestly, I think I was most surprised when "Whistle" reached number one on the music charts.
translation.zh:
‎说实话 《口哨》在音乐榜排第一
‎我是有点吃惊的

translation.en: That was the most exciting.
[in English] I remember we were…
[in Korean] …in a practice room when we heard the news
translation.zh: ‎我记得我们当时在练习房 ‎听到新闻说我们在榜上排第二了

translation.en: that we were number two.
translation.zh: ‎听到新闻说我们在榜上排第二了

translation.en: I kept on checking and checking, but we had to go to practice.
translation.zh: ‎我不断地去看 但是我们还得去练习

translation.en: We'd check every hour.
And then someone came in and said, "Oh, my God!"
[in English] We jumped up and down.
[in Korean] I remember my friends telling me that they heard it.
translation.zh:
‎我记得我的朋友们告诉我
‎说他们听了歌

translation.en: They were like, "I'm outside, and they're playing your song!"
translation.zh:
‎他们说：“我在外面
‎他们在放你的歌！”

translation.en: It felt really weird back then.
I was like, "Oh, my God, that's so cool! Shoot a video! Send me the video!"
translation.zh:
‎我心想：“天哪！好酷啊！
‎拍视频！把视频发给我！”

translation.en: [in English] Lisa! I love you!
[fan 1] I just really like their style.
translation.zh: ‎我真的非常喜欢她们的风格

translation.en: Their sound is super different from other K-pop groups.
translation.zh:
‎她们的声音
‎和其他韩国流行音乐组合很不一样

translation.en: [fan 2] It's 'cause they have so many foreign members,
and it really shows how anyone can achieve their dreams.
translation.zh:
‎真的让大家看到
‎每个人都能够实现自己的梦想

translation.en: [fan 3] They own the stage when they're on it.
translation.zh: ‎在舞台上时 她们就是舞台的主宰

translation.en: [in Korean] Their dance is so powerful.
[in Dutch] When their music is played, you just instantly start dancing.
translation.zh:
‎播放她们的音乐时
‎你立即就会跳起舞来

translation.en: [in English] They have the strongest friendship I've seen in a K-pop group.
translation.zh:
‎她们之间的感情
‎是我见过韩国流行音乐组合里最好的

translation.en: [in Spanish] You can see they love what they are doing and are born to do it.
translation.zh:
‎你可以看到 她们喜欢自己所做的事
‎而且很有天赋

translation.en: [in English] I felt like this is a girl group that I can actually vibe with.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得这个女团和我有共鸣

translation.en: [in English] You know, they cool.
They the baddest bitches alive. [laughs]
[Lisa in Thai] When I was a trainee, nobody knew about me.
translation.zh: ‎我是练习生的时候 没人知道我

translation.en: But after I debuted as BLACKPINK,
everyone would follow me no matter where I went.
translation.zh: ‎我去哪里都有很多人跟着我

translation.en: I didn't know that we would become this famous.
translation.zh: ‎我之前没想到我们会这么出名

translation.en: [Rosé in English] How much did you sleep last night?
[in Korean] Three hours.
-[in English] Three hours? -Yup.
-[staff 1 in Korean] Clear in front. -[staff 2] Everybody get out.
[Rosé in English] During trainee days, I was desperate. I really wanted it.
translation.zh:
‎在当练习生的日子里 我急得要命
‎非常想要出道

translation.en: But after debut, that's when you start getting a lot of responsibilities.
translation.zh:
‎但是出道之后
‎你开始要承担很多责任

translation.en: [man in Korean] Everybody look into the camera.
[Jisoo] Then came the pressure for our next thing. "What now? What do we do?"
translation.zh:
‎然后就是我们下一步的压力
‎“现在该怎么办？我们该怎么做？

translation.en: "Let's come up with something fresh." I felt like we were being chased.
translation.zh:
‎咱们想点新点子吧”
‎我感觉我们在被追着跑

translation.en: [director in English] Action!
[in Korean] The winner is BLACKPINK!
Thank you! I love you all!
[reporter 1 in English] It's a big day for BLACKPINK
as "Ddu-Du Ddu-Du" has become the most viewed Korean music video in 24 hours.
translation.zh:
‎《Ddu-Du Ddu-Du》在24小时内
‎成为观看次数最多的韩国音乐视频

translation.en: [reporter 2] Three music videos with over 400 million views.
translation.zh: ‎三个音乐视频 观看次数超过四亿

translation.en: [reporter 3] One billion views on YouTube.
[Rosé] I think when things get faster,
translation.zh: ‎我想 当事情发展更快的时候

translation.en: it also becomes very overwhelming at some points.
translation.zh: ‎也会在某些时候变得令人难以招架

translation.en: [inhales] Yeah.
[Lisa in Thai] I still remember the first time…
[Lisa] I went back to Thailand after my debut.
Because Thai teens see me as a Thai who has made it this far.
translation.zh: ‎因为在泰国的男生女生眼里 ‎我是取得了现在这样成绩的泰国人

translation.en: They would say, "I want to be like Lisa."
translation.zh: ‎他们会说：“我要像拉莉莎一样”

translation.en: [crowd chanting] Lisa!
WELCOME HOME LISA WE MISSED YOU
translation.zh:
‎（欢迎回家 拉莉莎
‎知道我们多么想念你吗？）

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] But at that moment,
translation.zh: ‎但是在那一刻 我不太确定

translation.en: I wasn't sure if I was really good enough to be their role model.
translation.zh:
‎但是在那一刻 我不太确定 ‎自己是否真的足够好
‎可以做他们的榜样

translation.en: [in Korean] I'm a singer… but I didn't know what kind of singer I wanted to be.
translation.zh:
‎我是一名歌手
‎但是我想成为什么样的歌手呢？

translation.en: I kind of lost the goal. I was trying to find myself.
translation.zh:
‎我当时有点丧失了目标
‎我想要找到我自己

translation.en: [in Thai] Could I really become their role model?
translation.zh: ‎我真的能成为他们的榜样吗？

translation.en: What should I do to not let them down?
translation.zh: ‎我怎么样做才能不让他们失望？

translation.en: These kinds of thoughts kept running through my mind.
translation.zh: ‎我脑子里一直在想这种问题

translation.en: [Jennie in English] We need sugar. [in singsong voice] We need sugar.
-[Jisoo] One spoon. -One spoon.
[Jisoo in Korean] You like this too. Tanghulu is different.
translation.zh: ‎不过你也喜欢吃这个 糖葫芦不一样

translation.en: [Jennie] Tanghulu has the sweetness of the fruits.
The ratio is a little off because we haven't made it in a while.
translation.zh:
‎比例有点不对
‎因为我们有一段时间没做了

translation.en: -There was too much sugar. -It's a bit burnt.
-It still looks delicious. -Yeah.
[in English] This is actually a Chinese traditional snack,
but it's hard to find it here in Korea.
[Jisoo in Korean] We almost started a fire once.
-We were making too much. -Yeah, we almost burnt it.
We almost made this dorm disappear. [chuckles]
[Jennie in English] This is a way of me teaching Jisoo to speak English.
translation.zh: ‎这是我教智秀说英语的一种方式

translation.en: She got better in the last six months.
She understands everything that I say, so I do talk to her in English sometimes.
translation.zh:
‎我说什么她都懂
‎所以我有时候用英语和她说话

translation.en: -[Jennie in Korean] How is it? -Mm.
Is it good? I want a taste. It's warm.
It's a bit burnt.
[in English] Not bad.
Not bad but not good.
Yeah. Let's be honest. It was a fail. Yes.
translation.zh:
‎-对 咱们说实话 做失败了
‎-对

translation.en: [in Korean] No. We didn't add any water.
-What are you talking about? -No, you don't add water.
Unnie! You add water.
You add water? No, you don't add water.
What am I going to do about you? Nothing works without me.
translation.zh:
‎我能拿你怎么办？
‎哎 没有我什么都搞不成

translation.en: [in English] In Korea, one of the first things you ask, other than your name, is how old are you?
translation.zh:
‎在韩国 除了名字之外
‎第一个问的就是年龄

translation.en: And as soon as they say they're older, it's like, "Oh, you're unnie."
translation.zh:
‎当别人说自己比你年龄大时
‎你就要叫别人“欧尼”

translation.en: So, unnie is basically what you call an older sister.
It's like--
[in Korean] Other places don't have it.
[in English] We don't call each other by names.
It's normally unnie if you're older than me, and oppa if you're a guy.
translation.zh:
‎如果你比我年龄大 就要叫你“欧尼”
‎如果你是男的 就要叫你“欧巴”

translation.en: It takes a while to get used to, but once you get a hold of it,
translation.zh: ‎喜欢这个要花一段时间 ‎但是一旦掌握了

translation.en: it's better than calling their names.
She's not Jisoo. She's unnie.
It's like family, in a way.
translation.zh: ‎从某种角度看 就像家人一样

translation.en: [in Korean] When I first came to train as a singer,
I had never tried singing or dancing before.
translation.zh: ‎我在之前从来没尝试过唱歌或者跳舞

translation.en: I was lost, but you taught me a lot.
translation.zh: ‎我当时很迷惘 但是你教了我很多

translation.en: For two of us, it was-- The competition was fierce at the time.
translation.zh: ‎对我们俩来说 真是… ‎当时的竞争很激烈

translation.en: There were about 20 to 30 trainees.
translation.zh: ‎当时有大概二三十个练习生

translation.en: Because we are the older ones of the group,
the others came to us with the issues they were having.
translation.zh: ‎所有其他人有问题就会来找我们

translation.en: I knew what their problems were. They'd ask us, "Unnie, what should we do?"
translation.zh:
‎我知道她们有什么问题 ‎她们会问我们
‎“姐 我们该怎么办啊？”

translation.en: And I'd advise them to speak their mind, but they have a hard time doing that,
translation.zh:
‎我会建议她们说出自己的想法
‎但她们不太能做到

translation.en: so I end up taking care of it.
translation.zh: ‎于是最后还是我帮她们解决

translation.en: There's no doubt I feel a sense of responsibility.
translation.zh: ‎毫无疑问 我感受到了责任

translation.en: I try the best I can to take care of the other girls.
translation.zh: ‎我尽我所能去照顾其他女孩

translation.en: [in English] It's okay, actually. I could eat this.
translation.zh: ‎其实还行 我可以吃这个

translation.en: [in Korean] Semi-success.
[man in English] Okay. It's just Rosé and the beat.
-Oh, my God! -No words, no melody whatsoever.
translation.zh:
‎-神啊！
‎-没有歌词 也没有曲调

translation.en: [man] So here we go.
[Rosé] You know how when people say they're afraid of heights
or they're afraid of water?
I've always been so afraid of getting in the studio or writing something.
translation.zh: ‎我总是很害怕进工作室 害怕写东西

translation.en: I always thought just someday I have to just start it. I have to.
translation.zh:
‎我一直觉得
‎有一天我要开始做 必须这样

translation.en: -I'm gonna still keep this one. -Okay.
-Let's try one more time. -Okay.
Do I change the rhythm? I keep going for the same thing.
translation.zh: ‎我要改节奏吗？我一直在唱一样的

translation.en: -Do you feel uncomfortable singing it? -Do I feel uncomfortable singing it?
translation.zh:
‎-这样唱你觉得不舒服吗？
‎-这样唱我觉得不舒服吗？

translation.en: Like slightly. Maybe I'll try singing it one more time.
translation.zh: ‎有一点 要不我再尝试唱一次

translation.en: I've seen Joe a few times, and his music's like amazing.
translation.zh: ‎我见过乔几次 他的音乐非常棒

translation.en: I was just like, to Teddy, "What do you think if he helps me out?"
translation.zh:
‎我对洪俊说
‎“你觉得他能帮到我吗？”

translation.en: So here's what we worked on. This is Rosé's first recorded song.
translation.zh:
‎这是我们做的项目
‎这是彩英第一次录的歌

translation.en: [Rosé] We even saved this whole file in this secret folder
translation.zh:
‎我们甚至把这整个文件
‎存在了秘密文件夹里

translation.en: because I said nobody can listen to it. I was like, "Hide it from everyone."
translation.zh:
‎因为我说谁都不能听
‎我说：“藏起来 不能让别人发现”

translation.en: When it comes to writing songs, Rosé has certain stories in mind.
translation.zh:
‎在写歌的方面
‎彩英头脑里有一些故事

translation.en: And she's shy about sharing that story. It's just super personal to her.
translation.zh:
‎她害羞 不想和别人说
‎这对她来说是特别个人的东西

translation.en: It's like her diary.
[Rosé laughs] Oh, my gosh!
You sounded nervous in that one.
Yeah. I'm like, "I don't know what I'm doing." [giggles]
translation.zh: ‎对 我好像不知道自己在干嘛

translation.en: I was thinking it'd be fun if I write something like…
translation.zh:
‎我在想 如果我写这样的东西
‎会很好玩

translation.en: [sings in Korean] ♪ After two, three o’clock… ♪ ♪ When I call you ♪
translation.zh: ‎两三点后 当我给你打电话

translation.en: ♪ And when you see my call… ♪
Something like that.
-I think it's fine. -I want to hide right now.
translation.zh:
‎-我觉得挺好
‎-我现在想藏起来

translation.en: -No. -I don't think I can do this. [laughs]
[in English] Teddy told me yesterday too.
He was like, "You need to learn how to be more vulnerable in the studio."
translation.zh:
‎他说：“你得学会
‎如何在工作室里更弱一点”

translation.en: That's something I can't do too easily, but I was gonna say--
translation.zh:
‎这件事我要做到不容易
‎不过我本来打算说…

translation.en: -[Joe] I mean, it takes time. -Yeah.
I really have a lot of respect for music,
so I don't wanna be just like another girl who sings
translation.zh: ‎我不希望像其他唱歌的女孩一样

translation.en: and just kind of tells everybody that she writes music.
That's the last thing I wanna be.
-Whoa, I need one of these. -[Joe] Yeah.
-[Rosé] Oh, my gosh. -[plays chords]
I feel more intimidated when I'm by myself.
translation.zh: ‎我自己一个人的时候 觉得更害怕

translation.en: When I'm in my room by myself,
translation.zh: ‎当我一个人在自己房间的时候

translation.en: and I go, "Should I try and write something?"
translation.zh: ‎我会想：“要不要试试写点什么呢？”

translation.en: I think I'm way more intimidated then.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得在这个时候我会害怕得多

translation.en: 'Cause it's just me. I don't know if my opinions are right,
translation.zh:
‎因为只有我在
‎我不知道我的看法对不对

translation.en: and that scares me. I feel like I scare myself the most.
translation.zh:
‎这令我害怕
‎我觉得我最令我自己害怕

translation.en: [Joe] Okay, let's record that.  What's our tempo?
translation.zh: ‎好的 咱们把这段录下来 什么拍子？

translation.en: I found these chords maybe like a month ago.
translation.zh: ‎这些调子 是我一个月前想到的

translation.en: I was like-- I liked it. I was like, "This sounds cool."
translation.zh:
‎我当时挺喜欢
‎我心想：“听起来挺不错啊”

translation.en: And ever since then, I just play it.
[Joe] If anything, I was gonna put you in the booth and sing over it.
translation.zh: ‎我会让你进录音棚去唱出来

translation.en: [Rosé giggles] Okay.
Do you think I could do it? I've never tried this.
translation.zh: ‎你觉得我行吗？我从没试过这样

translation.en: [Joe] I think you can do it. Let's just give it a try.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得你行的 咱们试试看

translation.en: It's nice to have just the right amount of people in the room,
translation.zh: ‎房间里的人不多不少 非常好

translation.en: who are just there to accept whatever is there
translation.zh: ‎他们在这里 接受这一切

translation.en: and make it into something.
translation.zh: ‎想办法把它做出一点东西来

translation.en: Joe always says, "This is the safe ground. Everything's a secret in here."
translation.zh:
‎乔总是说：“这里是安全地带
‎这里的一切都保密

translation.en: "You can make a fool out of yourself, and we won't tell anyone."
translation.zh: ‎你可以在这里犯傻 我们不会说出去”

translation.en: It feels just like expressing myself.
Whereas I would always sing songs of other artists.
That's more like borrowing their emotions and making it mine.
translation.zh:
‎那更像是借别人的情绪
‎把它变成我自己的

translation.en: Whereas this is totally just speaking from my point of view.
translation.zh: ‎而这是完全在说我自己的观点

translation.en: I'm almost like a baby trying to speak in the music,
translation.zh:
‎我几乎就像一个宝宝
‎想要用音乐来说话

translation.en: trying to sing… for the first time.
-[giggles] I lost it again. -[Joe] We got it.
[Jennie] Lisa, should I wear this on my way back?
translation.zh: ‎拉莉莎 ‎我回去的时候要穿这个吗？

translation.en: [Rosé in Korean] Kuma!
[in English] BLACKPINK hoodie?
-I think you should. -[Jennie] Right?
Hello. Ah, ow! You just bit me.  Coco bit me. Ah!
Coco like, "I don't care."
[Jisoo in Korean] I have so many clothes, but there's not enough space,
translation.zh: ‎我有很多衣服 不过地方不够

translation.en: so I keep them on the balcony. [laughs]
Don't we have to pack for the event in Japan?
translation.zh:
‎咱们不用打包东西
‎准备日本的活动吗？

translation.en: You have to bring something like this. It's cold.
-Bring a scarf too. -Oh, I don't have a scarf!
translation.zh:
‎-也带一条围巾
‎-噢！我没有围巾！

translation.en: -Give me one. -You are funny.
-Give me one. -I can't.
That's not a scarf.
It is so tiring when we work,
but when we don't work, I get stressed out about not working.
translation.zh:
‎但是我们不工作的时候
‎我会觉得不工作压力很大

translation.en: I think it's that. It's a dilemma.
When we work, I really want to rest,
translation.zh: ‎我们工作的时候 我真的不想休息

translation.en: but when we don't work, I end up wondering, "What am I doing?"
translation.zh:
‎但是我们不工作的时候
‎我会想：“我在干嘛？”

translation.en: [Rosé] This job has a lot of ups and downs. [Jisoo] There's nothing we can do about it.
translation.zh:
‎-这份工作有很多起起伏伏
‎-我们也没办法

translation.en: It's very random, and there's no regularity.
The thing is, you can never tell how long this will last,
translation.zh: ‎问题是你永远不知道会红多久

translation.en: so estimating is impossible. That's most challenging.
translation.zh:
‎所以预测是不可能的
‎这一点是最大的挑战

translation.en: [Jennie in English] This year has been on the road.
This year has been pack and unpack, and unpack and pack and unpack. That's a song.
translation.zh:
‎-今年一直在打包、拆包
‎-像一首歌

translation.en: [Jennie] At least right now, we're prepared enough to plan the resting part,
translation.zh:
‎至少 现在我们作好了充分准备
‎去计划安排休息

translation.en: 'cause last year, we were just like spending time like…
And then the tour hit us,
and we're like, "Oh, my God." [Rosé] Yeah.
translation.zh:
‎-我们都心想：“神啊！” 对！
‎-神啊！

translation.en: [Jisoo in Korean] I think we were together for three years before we went on the world tour.
translation.zh:
‎在举办世界巡回演唱会之前
‎我们在一起三年

translation.en: [Jennie in English] It was a long tour, about nine months.
translation.zh: ‎巡回演唱会很长 大概九个月

translation.en: [Lisa in Korean] We started the world tour in Asia,
but Coachella marked the start of our tour in North America.
translation.zh:
‎但是科切拉音乐节
‎标志着我们巡回演唱会在北美的开始

translation.en: [Rosé in English] When they said that we're gonna start going outside of Asia,
translation.zh: ‎当他们说我们要开始走出亚洲时

translation.en: that was like a dream.
[in Korean] And blow them kisses here and stuff,
because you're coming out during the chorus before you kiss.
translation.zh:
‎因为在你飞吻之前
‎你要从队伍里走出来

translation.en: Oh, the next chorus?
You're coming out during the chorus before you kiss.
translation.zh: ‎你要在飞吻之前 从队伍里走出来

translation.en: You want me to come out before that chorus?
Come out slowly and play here.
translation.zh: ‎慢慢地走出来就行 在这里跳

translation.en: It was getting boring when you stay out there for too long.
translation.zh: ‎你在那里待太久会变得无趣

translation.en: [Lisa] A much more diverse group of fans
will be looking forward to seeing us.
[Rosé in English] We wanted to bring them the best show possible.
translation.zh: ‎因为我们想要给他们带去最好的表演

translation.en: [choreographer in Korean] Whether it be "Playing With Fire" or "Boombayah"…
you don't look like you're dancing hard enough.
-We're not dancing hard enough? -Not hard enough.
translation.zh:
‎-我们跳得不够用力？
‎-不够用力

translation.en: The audience needs to be mesmerized by your energy, up close.
translation.zh: ‎观众得近距离着迷于你们的能量

translation.en: I know that you guys know the dance well, but put in a bit more effort.
translation.zh:
‎我知道你们对这支舞很熟悉
‎但是要再加把劲

translation.en: Jisoo, you need to get the notes right.
You messed up on the rhythm before, right? Too fast?
translation.zh:
‎你之前节奏乱过 对吧？
‎是太快了吗？

translation.en: I practiced with MR for the first time when I got here.
[choreographer] The notes are a bit unstable when you first go in.
translation.zh: ‎你刚开始唱的时候 调子有点不稳定

translation.en: But we shouldn't have said that on camera.
translation.zh: ‎不过我们不该当着摄像机说

translation.en: Hey… [bleeping]
They'll never air this.
[reporter 1 in Korean] The media says that K-pop queens have landed.
translation.zh: ‎媒体说韩国流行音乐女王来了

translation.en: [in English] BLACKPINK, welcome to Thailand. Yay!
translation.zh: ‎BLACKPINK 欢迎来到泰国 好哎！

translation.en: [in Korean] Girl group BLACKPINK heat up their first world tour stop, Thailand.
translation.zh:
‎女团BLACKPINK急剧升温
‎世界巡回演唱会第一站来到泰国

translation.en: It's special to have a concert in Lisa's hometown.
translation.zh:
‎在拉莉莎的家乡举办演唱会
‎有非常特殊的意义

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] This is the first concert where BLACKPINK has been able
translation.zh: ‎这是BLACKPINK ‎与我们泰国粉丝见面的第一个演唱会

translation.en: to meet our Thai fans.
translation.zh: ‎与我们泰国粉丝见面的第一个演唱会

translation.en: We will do our very best and will not disappoint the BLINKS.
translation.zh:
‎我们会全力以赴
‎绝不会让粉丝们失望

translation.en: [crowd chanting] BLACKPINK!
[Jisoo in Korean] I want to give a performance that I can look at and be content with.
translation.zh: ‎我希望表演能够令我自己满意

translation.en: My focus is leaving the stage having given a performance
translation.zh: ‎我的焦点在于表演完离开舞台的时候

translation.en: I have no regrets about.
So when I get out there, I'm thinking, "Don't mess this up."
translation.zh:
‎所以 当我上台的时候
‎我在想：“不要搞砸了

translation.en: [Jisoo] "You've got to nail this."
[Jennie in English] Since it was our very first world tour,
translation.zh:
‎因为这是我们第一次世界巡回演唱会 ‎所以看到这么多粉丝
‎坐满了巨大的体育场

translation.en: it's amazing to see all these fans
translation.zh:
‎所以看到这么多粉丝
‎坐满了巨大的体育场

translation.en: filling up the big arenas that we didn't expect.
translation.zh: ‎我们非常高兴 ‎这也是我们没想到的

translation.en: [Lisa in Korean] Everything was new to me on my first tour.
translation.zh:
‎我到处旅行的时候
‎对我来说 一切都是新的

translation.en: It was so great to meet so many fans around the world.
translation.zh:
‎能见到全世界这么多的粉丝
‎真是太好了

translation.en: [Jennie in English] Once it gets going, for, like, the next 30 days,
translation.zh: ‎然后 一旦开始之后 之后的30天

translation.en: to try to give them the best stage every day is a lot of pressure.
translation.zh: ‎想要每天尽力给大家最好的表演 ‎压力非常大

translation.en: [Jennie] After so many plane rides and so many environment changes,
translation.zh:
‎坐了这么多趟飞机
‎环境变得这么频繁

translation.en: our body just gives up on us.
-[in Korean] It feels like it's sprained. -Is it worse on this side?
translation.zh:
‎-感觉像扭伤了
‎-侧面是不是更糟糕？

translation.en: [Jennie in English] When I'm home, I like to workout and take care of my body
translation.zh:
‎回到家的时候
‎我喜欢健身 照顾好自己的身体

translation.en: 'cause I'm like a grandma. I'm sick everywhere.
translation.zh: ‎因为我像老奶奶一样 浑身是病

translation.en: Honestly, I need to take care of myself.
translation.zh: ‎说实话 我得照顾好我自己

translation.en: I lose breath a little easier than other people,
translation.zh: ‎我比别人更容易喘不过气来

translation.en: and I can't jump as much as other people.
[Rosé] I think, at first, I didn't know what I was headed towards.
translation.zh:
‎起初的时候
‎我想我不知道自己在往何处去

translation.en: [staff] Okay. Let's go.
I thought it would all be just really exciting and fun.
translation.zh: ‎我以为都会非常激动人心 非常有趣

translation.en: [in Korean] I’m going to eat it without ketchup.
[Rosé in English] In the middle of it, I didn't feel like I had a personal life.
translation.zh:
‎在巡回演唱会期间
‎我觉得自己没有任何个人生活

translation.en: It felt like there was this big hole in my life.
translation.zh: ‎我感觉我的生命中有一个大洞

translation.en: What I'm basically living for is tomorrow's show.
translation.zh: ‎我基本上只是为了明天的表演而活着

translation.en: I love being on stage because that's when I feel the most alive,
translation.zh:
‎我爱上舞台
‎因为这是我感到最有生命力的时候

translation.en: yet when we come back to the hotel, I felt so empty.
translation.zh:
‎但是当我们回到酒店时
‎我感到非常空虚

translation.en: [in Korean] I'm hungry, so I ordered something simple.
translation.zh: ‎我好饿 所以我简单地点了一些东西

translation.en: [in English] Poached eggs. Ta-da!
And that's when I realized I'm homesick.
[in Korean] Delicious.
[in English] Yeah! Let's go!
[Jennie] Lisa is the most constant one.
She brings positive energy into the group.
[Jisoo in Korean] If someone is fed up one day…
…she makes that person laugh.
She keeps us energized.
[Lisa in English] Sometimes I feel like…
[in Korean] …I think I overreact a lot.
Or I tend to try to bring too much positivity
translation.zh: ‎或者说在气氛不太好的时候

translation.en: when the mood is sour.
translation.zh: ‎我想要带入过多的正能量了

translation.en: -[Jennie in English] But it really helps. -Really?
-Yeah. -Okay.
I'll keep doing that.
-Keep going. -Yeah, keep going, Lisa! [laughs]
translation.zh:
‎-要继续！
‎-对 要继续 拉莉莎！

translation.en: [Rosé] How we stay tight as a group
translation.zh:
‎我们通过这样的方式
‎维持一个紧密的团队

translation.en: is we try to take care of ourselves individually,
and then come together healthy and happy so that the whole thing works.
translation.zh: ‎然后健康快乐地来到一起 ‎这样整个团队就好了

translation.en: [Jennie] Sometimes, when I look like I'm really tired and angry,
translation.zh: ‎有时候 ‎当我看起来真的很累很生气的时候

translation.en: that is my happy face.
We're all human, and we're ladies, so we have our moments.
translation.zh:
‎我们都是人 都是女人
‎所以我们都有情绪不好的时候

translation.en: But when you have the good positive energy going on, it helps.
translation.zh:
‎但是当你有正能量注入的时候
‎确实有帮助

translation.en: Los Angeles, what's up? We're BLACKPINK on 97.1 AMP radio.
translation.zh:
‎洛杉矶 你好！
‎我们是BLACKPINK 在97.1AMP电台

translation.en: [radio host] You guys, the first female Korean group to perform at Coachella.
translation.zh:
‎你们是首个
‎在科切拉音乐节表演的韩国女团

translation.en: -[all members] Oh, my gosh! -What?
[reporter] The K-pop girl band called BLACKPINK is in the US this weekend.
translation.zh:
‎韩国流行音乐女团BLACKPINK
‎本周末来到美国

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] Because it's such a big festival,
when I was told that we were going, I couldn't believe it.
translation.zh: ‎当我们得知要去的时候 我不敢相信

translation.en: [in English] Are we going to Coachella? BLACKPINK? Are you sure?
translation.zh:
‎我们要去科切拉音乐节？
‎BLACKPINK？你确定吗？

translation.en: [in Thai] Is this for real?
[Jisoo in Korean] Look over there!
[Rosé in English] I'm so excited. This is cool!
It was really nerve-wracking.
We're a group from South Korea representing our country.
translation.zh:
‎我们是来自韩国的组合
‎代表我们的国家

translation.en: [Jennie] We were just so ready to tell the world that we've been waiting for this.
translation.zh:
‎我们作好了准备 要告诉全世界
‎我们一直在等待这一天

translation.en: [in Korean] Since we don't have much time…
[in English] …we're gonna skip "Stay,"
and we're gonna go from "Whistle" and "Kiss and Make Up."
translation.zh: ‎我们从《口哨》和《亲吻和好》开始

translation.en: [Lisa in Korean] I was so nervous because I didn't know how our American fans would react.
translation.zh:
‎我当时非常紧张
‎因为不知道美国的粉丝会有什么反应

translation.en: [Rosé in English] Usually, a BLACKPINK tour is filled with fans who come to watch us,
translation.zh:
‎通常 来BLACKPINK巡回演唱会的
‎都是来看我们的粉丝

translation.en: but people who come to Coachella are just people who love music in general.
translation.zh:
‎但是来科切拉音乐节的人
‎只是热爱音乐

translation.en: I personally was really worried that not many people would walk up to our show.
translation.zh:
‎我自己非常担心
‎来看我们演出的人可能不多

translation.en: [Jennie] I didn't even think we would have, I don't know, 100 people or 200 people at least.
translation.zh: ‎我都不知道会不会有一两百人来

translation.en: I was just hoping to have somebody watching us.
[Jisoo in Korean] I was so sick.
That was the sickest I've ever been.
My back was killing me. It hurt to move.
translation.zh: ‎我的背痛得要死 动一下都会痛

translation.en: -I was pretty worried. -We were very worried.
[staff 1] Break a leg.
[staff 2] We're following Coachella.
[in English] Let's go.
[Jisoo in Korean] When I got onto that stage,
I actually didn't realize that there were so many people.
translation.zh: ‎我其实没意识到有这么多人

translation.en: [Rosé] Why are there so many people? [Jennie] I don't know.
translation.zh:
‎-为什么会有这么多人？
‎-不知道

translation.en: There are so many people.
-[Jennie] We can do it. -[Lisa] We can do it. It's fine.
translation.zh:
‎-我们行的
‎-我们行的 没事

translation.en: [all] One, two, three! Go!
[staff] Jennie and Rosé, that way.
Water, water, water!
Eye drops, somebody!
Relax.
[staff] We're starting now!
[Lisa in Thai] I was so nervous. The moment I stepped foot on the stage
translation.zh: ‎我踏上舞台那一刻 非常紧张

translation.en: and saw all the crowds shouting and cheering…
[Lisa] …I got the feeling, "This is it!"
[Jennie in English] I think Coachella was the moment where I felt like
translation.zh:
‎我想就是在科切拉音乐节上 ‎我感觉到 确实有人明白
‎这不只是韩国流行音乐

translation.en: there are people that understand that this isn't just K-pop music.
translation.zh:
‎我感觉到 确实有人明白
‎这不只是韩国流行音乐

translation.en: They see us as doing something new, and I really like that. [giggles]
translation.zh:
‎他们把我们看作在做新的东西
‎我真的喜欢这一点

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] All races and all kinds of people came together there.
translation.zh: ‎各个种族和各种人都可以齐聚在那里

translation.en: So it helped emphasize…
[in English] …this represents BLACKPINK.
[Jennie in English] I'm happy to be in an era
translation.zh: ‎我很高兴能生活在这样一个时代

translation.en: where people are open to new culture, new music.
translation.zh: ‎大家对新的文化和新的音乐很开放

translation.en: Who would have imagined, at Coachella,
translation.zh: ‎谁能想象 在科切拉音乐节

translation.en: thousands of people singing in Korean… [in Korean] "Playing with fire"? [in English] What?
translation.zh:
‎数以千计的人用韩语唱《玩火》
‎怎么可能啊？

translation.en: [Rosé in English] It doesn't matter the size of the audience.
It just matters if it's the right atmosphere.
Everybody's on the same vibe.
[Jennie in English] This was a moment where I felt really satisfied with our work.
translation.zh: ‎这一刻 我真的对我们的工作满意了

translation.en: Like all those training years were worth it!
[Lisa in Thai] It makes me feel that… I had chosen the right path.
translation.zh: ‎让我感觉到 我选对了路

translation.en: This was what I really wanted to do in my life.
translation.zh: ‎这是我人生中真的想做的事

translation.en: [Lisa in English] We had so much fun.
I think I'll remember today for the rest of my life.
translation.zh: ‎我想 这一天我会记一辈子

translation.en: [Jennie] We love you guys!
-[Jisoo] Thank you, guys! -[Lisa] Thank you so much.
[Rosé] Goodnight!
[reporter] There's been lots of news coming from Coachella,
but one group that has everybody talking is BLACKPINK.
translation.zh:
‎但有一个组合 大家都在聊
‎那就是BLACKPINK

translation.en: If you didn't know who they were before, you definitely know who they are now.
translation.zh:
‎如果你之前不知道她们是谁
‎那现在一定知道了

translation.en: [in Korean] After Coachella, I think I figured out
translation.zh: ‎科切拉音乐节之后 ‎我想我领悟出了如何在舞台上快乐

translation.en: how to have fun on stage.
translation.zh: ‎我想我领悟出了如何在舞台上快乐

translation.en: Don't concentrate on just yourself,
translation.zh: ‎不要把注意力放在自己身上

translation.en: but feed off this passion raging around you.

translation.en: and get replaced by a new younger generation.
As long as there is still someone talking about us.

translation.en: that's what makes things happen.
[Rosé in English] We love you, Bangkok!
Thank you so much!
[Rosé] Thank you.
Sadly, very, very extremely sadly,
Like we said before, this will be our last concert on this tour.

‎就像我们之前说的
‎这将是本次巡回的最后一场演唱会

translation.en: And I feel like all four of us, we did really well,

translation.en: and I'm very proud of each and every one of us.

translation.en: -'Cause we went through a lot. -[crowd screaming]
Like, I know you guys only see the stuff that's on stage,

translation.en: but I feel like we all go through so much else… [voice breaks] …and I'm very proud.

‎但是我觉得我们都经历了很多
‎我非常自豪

translation.zh:
‎在表演的时候
‎我们总是看外面 和观众们说话

translation.en: Then I was talking, and I kinda looked at my members,
translation.zh: ‎我在说话 我看了一下我的队友们

translation.en: and I was like, "Ah!" Then I started crying.
Because it felt like the first time talking to, you know, each.
translation.zh:
‎因为感觉就像
‎我第一次和你们每个人说话一样

translation.en: Like, I feel like it's so hard that everybody stays away from home…

translation.en: Happy tears.
-Happy tears. -Happy tears. It's okay.
translation.zh:
‎-喜极而泣
‎-喜极而泣 没关系

translation.en: -[all giggling] -I don't know why.
-Now I'm gonna cry. I don't want to cry. -[Rosé] Everybody's gonna cry.

‎-我要哭了 我不想哭

translation.en: -[Jisoo] Everyone, cry. -[Rosé] Everyone, cry! [laughs]
So, it's like a train. It's me and then Jennie unnie.

translation.en: [in Korean] I don't cry. [laughs]
I don't cry. I cry last.

‎-再见！

Bye!
[chuckles] A fan?

‎我们作为BLACKPINK所创造的东西
‎我非常骄傲

And so, it feels like a journey that they're on with us.

‎因为我觉得我们做得非常好

[waiter] Careful of the hot plate.

-Weren't you here before? -[Jisoo] Yes, that's right.

‎-我记得

‎我说：“别告诉我你在这里”

‎我觉得一见如故

‎她也这么说
‎我们都说：“这是咱们第一次见吗？”

translation.en: I'm like, "Yeah." She's just like us. She just talks like us.

‎我说：“是的” 她像我们一样
‎说话像我们一样

‎-她是美国人 还是…

‎-我想住在巴黎

I want to live in Paris, but I also want to live in the US and England.

No newborns!
Aren't we going to make a comeback?
